ILOPROST

Indications and doses

Idiopathic or familial pulmonary arterial hypertension (initiated under specialist supervision),

By inhalation of nebulised solution

  • For adults
    Initially 2.5 micrograms as a single dose, then increased to 5 micrograms as a second single dose, then increased if necessary up to 5 micrograms 6–9 times a day, adjusted according to response; reduced if not tolerated to 2.5 micrograms 6–9 times a day, reduce to lower maintenance dose if high dose not tolerated.

Advice when patient is pregnant

When used by inhalation

Use if potential benefit outweighs risk.

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

When used by inhalation

Initially 2.5 micrograms at intervals of 3–4 hours (max. 6 times daily), adjusted according to response (consult product literature).

When used by inhalation

Elimination reduced.

Contra indications

  • Conditions which increase risk of haemorrhage
  • congenital or acquired valvular defects of the myocardium
  • decompensated cardiac failure (unless under close medical supervision)
  • pulmonary veno-occlusive disease
  • severe arrhythmias
  • unstable angina
  • within 3 months of cerebrovascular events
  • within 6 months of myocardial infarction

Known side effects

General side effects

commonOrVeryCommon: Chest pain, cough, diarrhoea, dyspnoea, haemorrhage, headache, hypotension, jaw pain, nausea, oral irritation, rash, throat pain, vomiting,

notKnown: Bronchospasm, taste disturbance, thrombocytopenia, wheezing,

Directions for administration

When used by inhalation

For inhaled treatment, to minimise accidental exposure use only with nebulisers listed under Ventavis preparation in a well ventilated room.

National funding/access decisions

Cautions regarding administration

  • Hypotension (do not initiate if systolic blood pressure below 85 mmHg)
  • unstable pulmonary hypertension with advanced right heart failure
  • When used by inhalation: acute pulmonary infection
  • When used by inhalation: chronic obstructive pulmonary disease
  • When used by inhalation: severe asthma

Information regarding prescribing and dispensing

When used by inhalation

Delivery characteristics of nebuliser devices may vary—only switch devices under medical supervision.

Concentrate for infusion available on a named patient basis from Bayer Schering in 0.5 mL and 1 mL ampoules.

Prepared medicinal forms of ILOPROST

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Solution for infusion
Nebuliser liquid
